name: Trans-unsaturated fatty acid (Trans-fat)

references.credit: Elson Haas M. MD, Healthy.net, Building Blocks Of Nutrition: Fats, Lipids And Oils
Jennifer J. Otten, Jennifer Pitzi Hellwig, Linda D. Meyers, Editors, 'Dietary Reference Intakes: The Essential Guide to Nutrient Requirements', Dietary fat: Total fat and Fatty acids

summary: Trans-unsaturated fatty acids or, simply, trans fat are unsaturated fatty acids that have been hydrogenized (stabilised) during food processing to increase their shelf life for commercial purposes. They are found in all processed food and margarine. Trans fat cause inflammation. Long-term inflammation leads to chronic inflammation, that is, the immune system goes mad and triggers inflammation and immune reponses although there is no threat (it thinks it is something normal to do). This behaviour is an autoimmune problem caused by DNA damage and mutation. Chronic inflammation is the root cause of all diseases. Inflammation can be determined more precisely using a C-reactive protein (CRP) test. Eliminate trans fat found in processed food completely for the sake of your health and wellness.
